answers.answer: What it'll do is cause your baby to crave sugars, after being born. That means basically that when you have him/her it's like cutting off the gravy train and the baby could deal with BAD hypoglycemia (you know what that is right?)So think of what happens when a person goes thru hypoglycemia, that's what happens to the baby. You should be trying your best to control your sugars. that means no more foods w/tons of sugar, or very little.Gest. Diabetes also causes a baby to be born large, but can still me immature.All I'd suggest is that you watch your sugars, and talk to your dr. about the risks.What theyre gonna do is monitor the baby's sugar levels after its born to make sure they come w/in a normal range. :)
i went in for a scheduled c section at 38 weeks pregnant to find out that my son was dead... they did an autopsy and found out that it was because of my high blood sugars so please be very careful.

question: I am 35 weeks pregnant and have really high sugar levels...i had such a craving for candy today and ice cream that i ate some....can this affect my baby? Can these gestationla diabetes kill the baby?
title: Can gestational diabetes kill your baby?
